title: Craig Dobson
text:
Craig Dobson (born 23 January 1984) is a <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="midfielder">midfielder</a>, who is currently without a club. He is also a noted <a href="Freestyle%20football">football freestyler</a>, having appeared in the DVD "<a href="Urban%20Freestyler">Urban Freestyler</a>".
Club career.
Dobson started his career with <a href="Crystal%20Palace%20F.C.">Crystal Palace</a>, but having failed to make a first team appearance for the "Eagles", he joined <a href="Cheltenham%20Town%20F.C.">Cheltenham Town</a> in the summer of 2003. He made his debut on 27 September, coming on as an 80th minute <a href="substitute%20%28association%20football%29">substitute</a> for <a href="Bertie%20Cozic">Bertie Cozic</a> in a 2–0 defeat at <a href="Bristol%20Rovers%20F.C.">Bristol Rovers</a>' <a href="Memorial%20Stadium%20%28Bristol%29">Memorial Stadium</a>. He left the club after a couple of brief cameos in the league and <a href="Football%20League%20Trophy">Football League Trophy</a>. In June 2004, Dobson made his international debut for <a href="Jamaica%20national%20football%20team">Jamaica</a>, coming on as an 85th-minute substitute for <a href="Marlon%20King">Marlon King</a> in a 1-0 <a href="Unity%20Cup">Unity Cup</a> defeat to <a href="Republic%20of%20Ireland%20national%20football%20team">Republic of Ireland</a> at <a href="The%20Valley%20%28London%29">The Valley</a>.
With <a href="Conference%20National">Conference</a> club <a href="Barnet%20F.C.">Barnet</a> for the start of the <a href="2004%E2%80%9305%20in%20English%20football">2004–05</a> season, making four appearances. He was released in October 2004, after his month-long contract expired.
He spent <a href="2005%E2%80%9306%20in%20English%20football">2005–06</a> with <a href="Conference%20South">Conference South</a> side <a href="Cambridge%20City%20F.C.">Cambridge City</a>. He scored nine goals in 40 league appearances. At the end of the season he had a trial with <a href="Gillingham%20F.C.">Gillingham</a>.
Dobson signed with Conference outfit <a href="Stevenage%20F.C.">Stevenage Borough</a> for a four-figure fee before the start of the <a href="2006%E2%80%9307%20in%20English%20football">2006–07</a> season, he quickly established himself at <a href="Broadhall%20Way">Broadhall Way</a>, making 38 appearances in his maiden season. He scored a brace against <a href="Stafford%20Rangers%20F.C.">Stafford Rangers</a> on 9 September, <a href="George%20Boyd%20%28footballer%29">George Boyd</a> also netting a <a href="hat-trick">hat-trick</a> in a 6–0 win. Dobson scored a further three goals that season, including a 74th-minute goal in the <a href="2006%E2%80%9307%20FA%20Trophy">2007</a> <a href="FA%20Trophy">FA Trophy</a> final with <a href="Kidderminster%20Harriers%20F.C.">Kidderminster Harriers</a> at <a href="Wembley%20Stadium">Wembley</a>. Borough won the game 3–2 to lift the trophy.
Dobson was more clinical in front of goal during the <a href="Stevenage%20F.C.%20season%202007%E2%80%9308">2007–08</a> campaign, netting ten times in 30 games. He was transfer listed in January after refusing to sign a new deal. This brought him the attention of <a href="Football%20League%20Two">League Two</a> side <a href="Milton%20Keynes%20Dons%20F.C.">Milton Keynes Dons</a>, <a href="Paul%20Ince">Paul Ince</a> quickly brought him to for an undisclosed fee. He made his Dons debut in a 1–1 home draw with <a href="Morecambe%20F.C.">Morecambe</a> on 3 May, though was taken off in favour of <a href="Lloyd%20Dyer">Lloyd Dyer</a> at half time.
He made just the one appearance in <a href="2008%E2%80%9309%20in%20English%20football">2008–09</a>, playing the 2–1 defeat at <a href="Ninian%20Park">Ninian Park</a> to <a href="Cardiff%20City%20F.C.">Cardiff City</a>, in the <a href="Football%20League%20Cup">League Cup</a> Second Round. He spent December on loan at <a href="Wycombe%20Wanderers%20F.C.">Wycombe Wanderers</a>, but did not feature. Dobson had his contract terminated with MK Dons at the start of January 2009 by mutual consent, after suffering with groin and shin injuries during his year-long stay. He signed for <a href="Brentford%20F.C.">Brentford</a> in March 2009 on a two-month contract, but was released at the end of the season without playing a game, as Brentford were <a href="promotion%20and%20relegation">promoted</a> to <a href="Football%20League%20One">League One</a>.
He went on trial with <a href="Shrewsbury%20Town%20F.C.">Shrewsbury Town</a> for the <a href="2009%E2%80%9310%20in%20English%20football">2009–10</a> pre-season and played in their <a href="exhibition%20game">friendly</a> matches against <a href="Bridgnorth%20Town%20F.C.">Bridgnorth Town</a> and <a href="West%20Bromwich%20Albion%20F.C.">West Bromwich Albion</a>. In late September 2009, he was taken on trial at <a href="Port%20Vale%20F.C.">Port Vale</a> by <a href="Micky%20Adams">Micky Adams</a>. He signed a three-month contract with <a href="Mansfield%20Town%20F.C.">Mansfield Town</a> in October 2009, following a successful trial. In November 2009, Dobson joined <a href="Kettering%20Town%20F.C.">Kettering Town</a> on loan until 4 January 2010, when his contract with Mansfield expires.
In January 2010, Dobson joined <a href="Farnborough%20F.C.">Farnborough</a>. After a handful of appearances he was released on 26 March 2010, and joined <a href="Sutton%20United%20FC">Sutton United</a>. In July 2010, Dobson went on trial with <a href="Football%20League%20One">League One</a> side <a href="Leyton%20Orient%20F.C.">Leyton Orient</a>, playing the first half in a 2–0 win against <a href="Cray%20Wanderers%20F.C.">Cray Wanderers</a>. Dobson signed for <a href="Conference%20South">Conference South</a> club <a href="Thurrock%20F.C.">Thurrock</a> in October 2010, making his debut in the 1–0 away defeat to <a href="Braintree%20Town%20F.C.">Braintree Town</a>. In November 2010, he joined <a href="Football%20League%20Two">League Two</a> club <a href="Barnet%20F.C.">Barnet</a> on dual registration. He was released by Barnet and Thurrock in February 2011, shortly before joining <a href="Braintree%20Town%20F.C.">Braintree Town</a>, before transferring to <a href="Woking%20F.C.">Woking</a> later in that same month.
In July 2011 Dobson rejoined Kettering Town for the <a href="2011%E2%80%9312%20Football%20Conference">2011–12 season</a>. He suffered an <a href="anterior%20cruciate%20ligament">anterior cruciate ligament</a> injury on his first competitive appearance for the club, which led to his release from the club towards the end of the season.
After nearly two years out of football, Dobson was handed a trial at <a href="Concord%20Rangers%20F.C.">Concord Rangers</a> in July 2013.
International career.
Dobson is reported to have made a late appearance as a substitute for <a href="Jamaica%20national%20football%20team">Jamaica</a> in a friendly with the <a href="Republic%20of%20Ireland%20national%20football%20team">Republic of Ireland</a> in 2004. However "<a href="The%20Guardian">The Guardian</a>" reported that he was an unused substitute.
